name: Peter Andreae
content: Peter Andreae | Te Kura Mātai Pūkaha, Pūrorohiko / School of Engineering and Computer Science | Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Peter Andreae address 04 463 5834 Overview Peter has been connected to Artificial Intelligence since the 1960s when his father started researching Machine Learning systems. His first degree was in Electrical Engineering from the University of Canterbury (New Zealand); he then went to M.I.T. (Massachusetts Institute of Technology) and did a Masters (on a topic in complexity) and a PhD, in Machine Learning (finished in 1984). Since then he has been in Computer Science here at Victoria University of Wellington, first in the Department of Computer Science, then in the merged School of Mathematics, Statistics, and Computer Science, and now in the School of Engineering and Computer Science. He retired in April 2023 but still holds an adjunct position in the School of Engineering and Computer Science Academic positions Adjunct Professor, School of Engineering and Computer Science, Faculty of Engineering, Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Associate Professor, Engineering and Computer Science, Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Associate Dean (Students and Academic Development), Faculty of Engineering, Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Senior Lecturer, Computer Science/Mathematical & Computing Sciences/Engineering & Computer Science, Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington.
